alert.note: Alert for Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 22 at 2:27PM MDT until July 24 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... .Gusty southwest winds will increase across Southwest Idaho and Southeast Oregon, especially near the Nevada border, during the afternoon and evening hours Sunday and Monday with very low relative humidity. This will result in critical fire weather conditions. The strongest winds will arrive Monday afternoon and evening ahead of a cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MDT /2 PM PDT/ SUNDAY TO 9 PM MDT /8 PM PDT/ MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS...BURNS BLM AND VALE BLM...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 423...636 AND 637... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 3 PM MDT /2 PM PDT/ Sunday to 9 PM MDT /8 PM PDT/ Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph during the afternoon and evening hours. Lighter winds are expected Sunday night through Monday morning. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidities of 6 to 12 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
